values: Recently, I came to the realization that I'm starting to fall behind technology. Not that anyone can really keep up with it all, but a lot of my generation are doing a pretty darn good job. My solution was to finally get an RSS reader and get all the latest and greatest from the sites, blogs, etc that I love. I have it all, science, technology, tea (yup, that's right), health, fitness, gadgetry, art, music, blah blah blah. My new realization? This amount of newly streaming information always at my fingertips just makes me want to get more. I'm feeling information overload coming on...maybe in a few weeks. Anyway, here are a few things I learned about today: Mojave Desert Phone Booth Giant Poo Flinging Catapult Skeleton Wedding Cake Seed Vault Art

An amusing conversation between myself and my coworker. This could be straight out of Dilbert, which makes it even funnier, because it is straight out of my life. I think that validates the legitimacy of Dilbert. :-) this is paraphrased... coworker: we need to cover one day this weekend, talk to Bob when he gets in tomorrow and figure out which day you both want to work. coworker: also, its supposed to snow friday night into saturday, so I suggest you don't pick saturday as the day. me: or, we could pick saturday, and then throw our hands up in despair when saturday comes and the weather precludes us from making it into work. ***laughter from crowd in lab*** coworker: Kat, you are destined for management.

I am feeling very very very grumpy.  I'm am so incredibly annoyed by this guy at work who won't shut up.  He keeps asking me why things aren't a certain way, as if I hadn't already thought of these things myself.  everything is all crunching, imploding into a ball of aluminum foil packed tightly in my chest.  

There are definitely moments where I feel like I am moments away from becoming a recluse.  I just keep thinking I could just drop everything and disappear.  I honestly don't even know why.  Maybe feeling the weight of so many "things" being carried around.  Today I have been listening to the same song, exclusively, on repeat, over and over and over.  Say, by JM.  The lyrics are simple, the vocals are really getting to me emotionally, and I figure if i just play it over and over maybe it'll stick.

Ever wished that you could go treasure hunting?  Seems like fun right?  Do you take great pleasure in adding stamps to your passport?  Well then letterboxing is definitely for you.  :-)  

Check out www.letterboxing.org  for all the details and happy hunting!!

I find my blogging inspiration more frequently from reading other blogs. Specifically, Marks. So, if you aren't mark reading this right now, go read his blog and be learned. Today, as I read words about one of the greats, referred to with terms of endearment, Marty, and despite the fact that it was his Marty's day, I can't help but think of my favorite Marty. My Marty also has a way with words, although not as much exposure. Because there aren't enough days in a year for everyone to have their own day without sharing, I've decided that MLKJ should share his day with another Marty, or all Martys, and so, I rename it Marty day. Here are some excerpts. Every single time I come to this town It brings out the worst in me Decadence dries deep in the root of mine eyes To bring out a thirst in me Bust in to Burbank and buy a big beef jerky on Barham Stare into the stockyard Life in this car out on the road Can be so easy Then in the evening time There's a welcome sight In my lazy dream I'm still hoping to find The best in me is the beast in me The best in me is the beast in me ~Beast in Me say cheri cheri won't you dare to leave a message and your number please Tie them up all my old fantasies Put them in a big red bow and send them care of me I'm taking a chance on the wind I'm packing all my bags Taking a mistake I gotta make then I'm glory bound ~Glory Bound Does Satan wear a suit and tie Or does he work at the Dairy Queen Does he listen to rock and roll Does he feed the mean Singing Hallelujah What about Jesus Didn't he do it too? Hang out with prostitutes And have a drink or two. Power of example My mama said it and I heard She says one ounce of action Beats a ton of words. Singing Hallelujah. Mama said there would be angels Mama said there would be sun Is the devil in Elvis to go where no white man went Or hiding in Hugh Hefner's body or maybe even Larry Flynt. Say, hows about the President shielding all them stones Man if I could find a shield like that I'd run 'round naked in my glass home. Sippin' Hallelujah I think my angel's gone to Vegas Sippin' Hallelujah Holding aces in her hand. Hallelujah As she's singing rock of ages. Hallelujah On the table at the Sands. Hallelujah ~Hallelujah Also, completely separately, I have this urge to move to a large island of ice somewhere very close to the north pole, where door handles turn upward to prevent polar bears from accidentally opening them. Maybe.

I find myself taking an online training module on EVMS, or Earned Value Management Systems.  On its own, not such a bad thing.  In fact, the concept is quite organized, smart, efficient, etc.  However, this module is just about the dullest thing on the planet.  Ever since college graduation I have missed school.  This module makes me glad that I am not actually in school any longer.  To get credit I have to get 100% on the exam.  The words on these slides appear to me as ink blots and the narration a high pitched dull beep, like that of the emergency broadcast system.  This beep is occasionally interrupted by the mechanical enunciation of an acronym or a MIL standard document number.  I hate acronyms and documents with numbers rather than meaningful names.  Even as I type, my internal dialogue is devolving to a monotone hum consistent with that of the powerpoint narrator's.  I think its' time to go home.

I've read this before, but mark's blog reminded me of it. Studies have shown that brain scans of people supposedly in love are remarkably similar to those of people with serious mental illnesses such as drug addictions and obsessive compulsive disorder. Read here for more on the subject. I just find that very revealing. I've called people crazy for doing certain things while in love. I guess maybe they were. I seriously need a fun vacation. I've been thinking about taking a train out west, possibly to seattle for a few days, and then down to oregon by either train or bus for a few days. It could be a fun little adventure. Or, maybe i'll just fly out there and save myself the time and money. I really would enjoy the train ride however. Like detox from life.

is disease.  that's right.  ever sit up at night, awake, wondering what you are?  wondering what you'll be?  wondering how you'll die?  Do you have an extra $1K lying around?  www.23andme.com  

Ever watched Gattaca?

blurring lines
between, throughout
camaraderie?
or is it?
shades of grey
my dear

tell me why we always miss things when they are gone?
that gifted shiny hand blender, which you thought was great, but never used in 5 years... so you get rid of it, and then the next week, you find yourself seriously in need of a hand blender and you wish it were there.  Or the old piece of furniture you thought was so unique. You loved it, you planned on refurbishing it and just never found the time or the courage to sand the first patch, and a month after trashing it, you have this epiphany, and a whole free weekend, and you can't think of anything but that piece and what you could do to make it perfect, if only you had it.  Where it is... what its doing... if it was found and is living with someone else now?  

absence makes the heart grow fonder?  Is this related?

How about the whole ruining friendships adage?  people say friends make the best relationships, but then what about breaking the glass bubble?  the second someone says or does something to change that, either something great happens, or it will never be the same again, and also nothing great.  unless you are both really drunk, then you have an excuse the next day, and everyone can usually forget that anything happened.  I guess that's the way to go.  or, forever hold your peace.  maybe that's the way to go.  Or maybe, i should just stop thinking, leave work and go snowboarding.  

last night was fun.  not too many trails open, but it was good!
but here is an interesting article with a general theme of -> Have More Sex! I enjoyed the article. But, maybe just because its personally beneficial. ha. :-)

I like quotes too!
Postmodernists believe that truth is myth, and myth, truth. This equation has its roots in pop psychology. The same people also believe that emotions are a form of reality. There used to be another name for this state of mind. It used to be called psychosis. ~Brad Holland And here's a pic of Mark at the Halloween party! (nice costume mark!)
No words of wisdom from Mark recently.  Mark, where did you go?  Are you getting settled in Oregon?  I am feeling less inspired...

a few quick things. anyone tried google's streetview yet? it creeps me out. I feel like a spy. also, I was introduced to some amazing art this weekend by a guy named Phil Borges. you should Check it out.

No more censorship.  If you think you know what this is about, you might be right, you might be wrong, whatever. 

I think when feelings about other people are seriously affected by a significant other, its time to reevaluate.  I should have seen/known that a long long long time ago.  Everything can just get so flipped and skewed inside a brain being inundated by chemicals of infatuation.  Or whatever.  All of it affects even those who you think have "great" integrity.  Or who think they themselves have great integrity.  We've all seen how the house of cards falls.  

Kudos to K for the most recent blog.  I totally agree.

30 Things You'd Never Think to Ask

1. Have you ever been searched by the cops?
nope

2. Do you close your eyes on roller coaster?
sometimes

3. When's the last time you've been sledding?
a few weeks ago with bob and crew!

4. Would you rather sleep with someone else, or alone?
with someone

5. Do you believe in ghosts?
not really

6. Do you consider yourself creative?
somewhat

7. Do you think O.J. killed his wife?
yes

8. Jennifer Aniston or Angelina Jolie?
neither, they are both too stick skinny for me.  I pick Jennifer Garner in her Alias days.

9. Can you honestly say you know ANYTHING about politics?
nope

10. Do you know how to play poker?
yes, but i haven't in a while

11. Have you ever been awake for 48 hours straight?
yes!  many times in college

12. What's your favorite commercial?
i don't watch commercials, i have a tivo

13. Who was your first love?
Matthew D Haney

14. If you're driving in the middle of the night, and no one is around you, do you run a red light?
if i'm in a real hurry, yes

15. Do you have a secret that no one knows but you?
yes

16. Boston Red Sox or New York Yankees?
Red Sox!!!

17. Have you ever been Ice Skating?
yes!  so much fun!

18. How often do you remember your dreams?
not often

19. What's the one thing on your mind?
someone special

20. Do you always wear your seat belt?
yes, absolutely

21. What talent do you wish you had?
mad guitar skills

22. Do you like Sushi?
I LOVE SUSHI.  probably more than any other food.  dim sum is close behind

23. What do you wear to bed?
it depends on the weather in my home.  anything from undies to full flannels

24. Do you truly hate anyone?
i don't think so

25. If you could sleep with one famous person, who would it be?
wentworth miller

26. Do you know anyone in jail?
nope, i don't think so

27. What food do you find disgusting?
none, i don't think

28. Have you ever made fun of your friends behind their back?
sure

29. Have you ever been punched in the face?
nope, i don't think so

30. Do you believe in angels and demons?
a little

Freakin Trent Reznor. That guy. wow. I hurt myself today to see if I still feel I focus on the pain the only thing that's real the needle tears a hole the old familiar sting try to kill it all away but I remember everything what have I become? my sweetest friend everyone I know goes away in the end you could have it all my empire of dirt I will let you down I will make you hurt I wear my crown of thorns on my liar's chair full of broken thoughts I cannot repair beneath the stain of time the feeling disappears you are someone else I am still right here what have I become? my sweetest friend everyone I know goes away in the end you could have it all my empire of dirt I will let you down I will make you hurt If I could start again a million miles away I would keep myself I would find a way I just remembered how amazing that song is.

So, I recently met someone really amazing.  And, I really respect him, unlike a previous interest.  I'm not going to say too much, so that I don't jinx it (because that's what happens when you talk too much about good things...) but lets just say its really f'ing awesome.  

Also, I learned to play 'Dear Mr. President' on the guitar, which I love.

Also, at the end of this month i'm going to be taking some fun weekend trips, which I love.

Also, Sara's wedding is coming up in Savannah, and I'm making that into a weeklong vacation, which I love.

Also, mark is going to Oregon to pick a grad school, and that rocks.  I will be lost without his journal posts. 

Also, I think true happiness is starting to seep back into my skin.  Still ever so slowly, but I have hope.  

Also, I have coffee right now.  YAAY!

oh yeah, and I came to the realization yesterday (or maybe some days previous) that moving to westminster is probably going to be the best thing that has happened to me in a long while. Two major reasons and a bunch of minor ones.
  • 1. Alicia and Jason are pretty much the best friends a gal can have. They have never faltered. Truly, I think I can say never. They know me so well that they know what I need. They aren't afraid to slap me into shape. And whenever i've needed them, they are there in a heartbeat. Besides them, I can say that for only maybe 2 other people in my life, excluding family. Not only that, they are fun as hell, smart and crafty.

  • 2. We will be living in a house on 3 acres of land. This means sweetie can stay outside and run around until she is exhausted. It means I can build her a doghouse. It means we can have a garden!! huge firepit with bench seating. campouts. home improvement projects that involve demolition. summer BBQs, volleyball, riding lawnmower, did I mention HUGE firepit????? there will be parties, singalonging, marshmallow roasting, and stuff. lots of stuff. I'm telling you, its going to be great!

so, britney spears shaved her head. good for her. speculation on whether this is going to hurt her career is irrelevant. she doesn't need a career. she has all the money she will ever need. she has two kids to take care of. what she needs is a life, some self respect, personal responsibility, and courage. I don't know why she did it, but I suspect it was for the same reason I do some of the things I do. I suspect it was to affect some sort of change, some realization, some new state of being that will allow her to figure out happiness again. or she got gum stuck in her hair... either way, leave the poor girl alone. I personally think she's been acting like trailer trash lately, and i don't respect it. but, that isn't to say that she's a bad person. everything is cyclic. everything. and i'm not about to say it couldn't happen to me. so britney, good luck. in other news, I am going to get another tattoo. maybe soon. I have an idea for something below the lotus that involves fire. also, i need to buy [some] new guitars. or one new guitar, and pickups for my acoustic so i can bring it to open mics. but, i'm thinking i might just try to find a used acoustic/electric. who's coming with me to daddy's junkie music? right on. i'm going to also need a practice amp and a looping station. :) Also, read this, its pretty amazing. I need to start writing some music. I need to learn to finger pick. I need a vacation already, and its only february...

The basic nature of the human race is not all for one and one for all.  I think selfishness is just instinct.  How can I get mad at instinct?  I don't.  Any of my annoyance (not anger) comes from the lack of honesty and lack of responsibility that people take for themselves and their actions.  Nobody is perfect, and I'm certainly not on some high horse myself, but at least I'll admit to being an asshole at times.  At least I care when I hurt people and will make a genuine effort to make them feel better.  Maybe this is just a disparity in how people (specifically them vs. me) show their feelings, but probably not.  There are times when I don't see that I'm being a dick, but I pray that my true friends will tell me when I am.  I love my friends because they help me, they teach me, they share and learn with me, they experience with me.  I don't want friends who will just agree with me to 'support' me.  I don't consider 'sticking by me' to be the same as agreeing with me.  A friend who sticks by me is a friend who continues to help me grow as a person and doesn't get mad when I try to help them grow.  Sometimes that means telling your friend they are being lame.  Sometimes that means telling your friend they are awesome.  Sometimes that means telling your friend that no matter what they do, or what they say to you, you'll be there to take another hit, catch another tear, and carry them when they can no longer walk.  Sometimes life is complicated, but sometimes life really is this simple.  Sometimes when it works, its a beautiful thing.

I've been making a lot of hard times for myself lately.  so stupid.  not intentionally of course.  I feel so far away from everything and everyone.  I have no comfort.  When I'm feeling bad, about anything, about myself, I wish i just had somewhere I could go and feel comfortable.  not OK, I know that's asking too much, just comfortable.  Right now I feel like I'm itching in my own skin and I can't get the burn to go away.  There are a few people that I don't even know very well, but I feel really comfortable with.  Unfortunately, they are virtually unreachable.  And really, they don't need to be dealing with me.  This is something I just can't quite reach.  I just can't find.  This is a moment to swallow.

I have been here many times before
I hurt myself again today
and the worst part is there's noone else to blame

be my friend
hold me
wrap me up
unfold me
i am small
and needy
warm me up
and breathe me

ouch, i have lost myself again

I hate everything about last night.  Except the few good moments before I went nuts.  And except Autumn, Lauren and Kevin being good friends, that was nice.  But otherwise, I was a crazy person (after I promised everyone I wouldn't be) and I caused a huge scene and I couldn't stop crying and all I wanted was to be left alone, and to be not left alone, which is a huge internal conflict.  

I am weak
I am selfish
I am crazy
I am inconsolable
I am not fun
I am uncontrollable
I am a bad decision maker
I am a drunk
I am my own worst enemy
I am a stupid girl
I am a bitch
I am retarded
I am mean
I am lonely
I am sad
I am what I hate

Ah, the craziness that is my life.  I'm hoping to get a few issues ironed out this week. For one, just waiting on that response, but I think i'll have to wait until the morning.  Wednesday is going to be fun!  cross your fingers for no drama!

Also, Krystal has started running with me.  Its great to have a buddy!  yaay

for those of you who are anxiously awaiting my next post, wait no further!  

the weekend was mostly awesome!

friday night I went out with some college friends for polish food to celebrate Polish Independance Day!  The food at Cafe Polonia was fantastic and the company was great as usual.  

saturday morning I got to spend some time with someone very dear to me.  I had a great time, but it was also heartbreaking as usual.  

saturday night I went to see Outside In play at the Ale House, and got to hang with lots of friends, including an old high school friend, Luko, current buddies Ricky and Heather, Autumn, Lauren (who drove all the way up from RI), roomate Krystal and various band members.  yaay, fun

Sunday I ate yummy pancakes, went to see Borat again (so awesome) and chilled with a bunch of friends at Autumns.  We then went to the new Friendly's in Lawrence to participate in friends and family night where we were served tons of free food!!!!!!!!!!!  That ended the weekend on a good note.  :-)

so, in thinking about the last line of my last entry, i've decided that my emotional state will be aided by more running.  I always feel better when I am more active, even though I am lazy about getting going.  So, I think I'm going to get back into my old habits of college years.  go to sleep in running clothes, wake up in the morning, put on socks and shoes, go running, take shower, go to work.  This will allow me to run outside in the light (by the time i get home it is pitch black).  Also, I am generally so NOT awake that I forget i'm running for about the first 15 or 20 minutes.  Also, I can do some weight training or cardio when i go to the gym at night a few times a week, instead of running.  Since I'm going out to a show in Waltham tonight though, this will probably start this weekend, or next week.  :)  Here's a poem I wrote years ago.

running away
each step
sounds the same
and a million wouldn't drive me crazy

each step
brings me that much farther
from everything
I can't handle or never wanted to

sounds the same
as my brain
when nothings really right
and all I want is nothing to do

and a million
of these runs won't do
a million times I leave
and always back to here

wouldn't drive me crazy
to not have to run
in so many ways
but always here; I'll always be right here

life has been pretty darn good lately thanks to a few certain people!  the only thing that is weighing me down is uncertainty.  I can deal with it, but it does really get to me sometimes.  Its like this feeling of anticipation mixed with worry.  Like the feeling you got as a kid when you were waiting for christmas to come, except i'm not sure its going to come.  crazy.  The thing is, the holidays are coming, and I would like to be able to enjoy them without being on edge all the time.  I'm all over the place.  the highest highs and the lowest lows.  it all gets jumbled up in my gut and stays there like a tumor. all i can do is be patient.  and run more.

I would just like to express my JOY and EXCITEMENT that the holidays are almost here.  I don't make too big a deal of most holidays that pass throughout the year, but I love the time we call "the holiday season."  I think this is mostly because I have a reasonably large family, and holiday gatherings are always fun.  Also, my mom always did a great job decorating for thanksgiving and christmas, and kept a lot of neat traditions alive, so I just have a lot of really warm memories.  The past few years the holidays have been hard because a lot of close relatives have passed on, and its hard to not see them when they should be there.  I finally think this year I am more accustomed to them not being around, and I think I've done my coping and my mourning.  I finally think that I can enjoy the holidays again and have great memories of when everyone was around and just be grateful for those times.  The day after thanksgiving, i'm popping the christmas CDs in.  And they don't go away until mid January!!!  Jingle Bells, Jingle Bells...

the only way out
is up
or down
never so sure
which is easier
and which is happier
and happier for whom

the right time
is now
or never
can't be sure
which is right
and which is wrong
or maybe both grey

the right thing
is here
or there
i'd hate to be sure
about one
or the other
because I'd have to let go

to know

Certain people have this insatiable need to define everything.  relationships, feelings, essence, intangibles.  I think the beauty of much of life is the indescribable and all the grey.  I'll throw out a huge one for y'all.  LOVE.  I can't define it, but I feel it.  I've tried to figure it out before, but I don't think I made any progress, and I don't really want to.  I can be content just to feel it, and not define it.  I've heard so many analogies and its all so cliche.  This is starting to remind me of one time I was rock climbing out at Crow Hill and after I rigged up the top rope, I tied in and sat at the edge of the cliff in the early morning and looked out at the landscape.  I've done it before, and its always nice, but nothing beats this day.  The sun, the colors, the smells, the breeze.  So many things came together in that moment to make it right and I'll never be able to explain what I felt.  All I can say is it was good, it was indescribable, and I feel like I wouldn't be doing it any justice to try to find the words, or an analogy that I think fits.  

I think this is why I'm not really a writer.  I guess I just don't want to find the words.  Sometimes, I think they cheapen it all...  I do love to read though, so I'm glad somebody is a writer!  HA

I don't know how I feel about victims.  My friend Abby got me thinking about this.

I was pissed off at her because she has some stuff of mine.  This stuff was left with her by another friend, and abby lived in my city, so we thought it would be easy for us to get together so I could get the stuff.

Its been over a year now and I still don't have the stuff.  This is because she was in a relationship which she claims was controlling and abusive.  I tried many times to go to her place to get the stuff, but she always said she had no time.  or her boyfriend wouldn't let me.  I just thought she was totally dependant on her boyfriend and was being a shitty friend.

The thing is, I sort of feel that calling yourself 'the victim' is a total cop-out.  Life doesn't happen to you, you make life happen.  I make my experiences what they are.  I chose to be with who I want, and if it turns out bad, I always think it is partially my fault, and that's not me getting down on myself, that's me taking responsibility for myself.  I really fucking hate people who don't take responsibility for themselves.  yes, that guy may have been a dick to my friend, but she chose him, she chose to stay with him, and she chose to ignore her friends because of him.  I beleive there is always a way out, but its all about strength.  There are a lot of things in life that are hard to do, but does that mean you don't do them????  FUCK NO.  

I also have issue with people giving others a guilt trip using the excuse that they are the victim.  So, you were a bitch to me for a long time because you were in a bad relationship, and because I'm pissed about it, you tell me to go to hell?  Because I should be more sensitive that you were in a bad relationship??  You should be more sensitive that I had to deal with you being in a bad relationship.  Yes, I sound like a total douche right now.  I know.  I don't even care.  I really am sympathetic most of the time.  But, I have a sore spot when it comes to relationship trouble.  I just feel very strongly that people in bad relationships should get the fuck out of them and stop wasting everyone else's time.  And stop playing the victim card, and stop saying that they are being manipulated...if you can tell me you are being manipulated, IT ISN'T REALLY MANIPULATION.  It is you being a pussy.  yes you, you know who you are.  WTF

I AM NOT A VICTIM

PLEASE FEEL FREE TO KICK MY ASS IF I START ACTING LIKE A PUSSY.  I'M SERIOUS.

So, the Halloween party was killer again this year.  Lots of great costumes, and only a few people who didn't dress up.  There was lots of beirut, punch, jello shots, singing and guitar playing and vomiting.  Overall, i'd say it was a huge success.  I can't wait for next year!  

Some of the pics are here:  http://www.picasaweb.google.com/mucky1217 

Thank you to everyone who came and made the party awesome!!!  I had a fantastic time!

I consider myself agnostic, and I am at complete peace with that, and here is why:  I don't think it matters if god exists or doesn't.  When I say god, I mean any almighty power/being whatever.  Lets explore this a little.

first off, most people who believe in god believe he/she is an almighty being who created the earth.  here is a better definition:

god (gd)  Pronunciation Key    
n. 
God
1) a.  A being conceived as the perfect, omnipotent, omniscient originator and ruler of the universe, the principal object of faith and worship in monotheistic religions. 
   b.  The force, effect, or a manifestation or aspect of this being. 
2)     A being of supernatural powers or attributes, believed in and worshiped by a people, especially a male deity thought to control some part of nature or reality. 
3)     An image of a supernatural being; an idol. 
4)     One that is worshiped, idealized, or followed: Money was their god. 
5)     A very handsome man. 
6)     A powerful ruler or despot. 

I know this whole blog is a little vague, since there are many different visions of who god is, so lets just go with the christian vision of god, since I was raised catholic.  If you aren't familiar, check out http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trinity .  I think you'll find that my thought process can be applied to any vision of god though.

also, i'll be simplifying everything to the extreme, just for the sake of time.  feel free to rant about it.

so, essential to god's existence is the idea of heaven and hell.  heaven being the place that you go if you are a good christian person.  how do you get to heaven?  according to wikipedia: 
<quote>'entrance to Heaven is conditional on having lived a "good life" (within the terms of the spiritual system. Catholicism and Anglican Christianity states that "He that believeth and is baptised shall be saved." These religions also state that someone must repent (turn back) from sin in order to get to heaven.'</quote>

So, If I live a good life, am baptised, believe in god and repent, i'm all set.  So, since god is almighty, he/she must have made up these rules.  This tells me that God won't let anyone in if they don't beleive in him.  I feel like that is pretty spiteful of him.  I thought god was compassionate?  I don't have any respect for a deity that would put out perfectly nice, good people just because they don't believe in him.  Therefore, I refuse to worship said god and don't care if I get into his heaven.  doesn't seem like a cool place anyway if he is the management, so i'll take my chances with the devil.

If you beleive that is not true, that god would let in anyone who was good, regardless of whether they believed or not, then I'm good to go, since I believe i am good, despite my lack of god-worship.

There ends my theory.  If god is truly all-loving and forgiving (the type of god that I would worship) then he doesn't care if I worship him, just that I am a good person, and if so, i'll get into heaven and meet him.  If god is really power-hungry and spiteful and wants everyone to believe in him and worship him, then I wouldn't worship him anyway, cause he sounds like a douche, and I don't want to be hanging out with a douche for all eternity anyway (that's a friggin long time).

weird dream I had last night.  life moved very fast, seasons changed in minutes and the pages of a calendar flew by.  all of the images in the dream were of people being happy, taking pictures, snapshots of moments in time and making albums.  and all the photos started to pile up over the years, nobody wants to let them go. there are too many memories after a while that even with the pictures in front of you, you forget the moment.  maybe there is some hidden meaning behind a world crowded with photos that nobody will let go, or maybe not.  I don't get it, it was just interesting.

no, not pocket change.  I think pocket change is bad, but otherwise, I think change is good!  

Recently, I decided I need to change, if for no other reason than just to be fresh.  One big part of that was moving.  Another part was some new piercings!  I also want to get my first tattoo very soon.  Those are some very noticeable changes, some physical even, but I have a lot of other things to change too.  I think I need to learn to be a better friend.  I don't mean I'm a bad one now, but maybe I can be sometimes.  I think I need to listen harder, and help more.  I think I need to give more.  I think I need to be thankful more.  

I also think I need to be more free.  I constantly feel the constriction of the civilized world, of corporate BS, and societal norms.  I've never been one to conform too much, but at the same time, I don't think I rebel enough.

I need to slow down and smell the roses.  I want to be outside more, because sometimes I forget about nature, beautiful smells and colors and vibrance.  I am excited for the snowboarding season.  I need to buy a helmet so I can learn some crazy stuff and not be afraid to go faster.  I hope I don't break my neck.  Mark, are you up for some more road trips?

I need to stay stronger.  physically and mentally.  Rugby has helped me keep in shape to some degree, but I still feel like a slug sometimes.  I'm joining a gym in Gardner, and I'm going to have some high school buddies of mine kick my ass into shape, and Autumn is going to come to the gym with me, and we're going to be super hot!

I need to generally take better care of myself, sleep a little more (I said a little, because I think I'll have plenty of time to sleep when I die!) read a little more, eat a little better, love a little more.

I want to love a lot more actually.  Maybe someone can help me with that.

Hopefully you will all see a change for the better!!!

I can put myself through a lot and still be ok.  But, when it really starts to affect friends, I figure its time to let go.  I think I can make my peace with this.  It was fun while it lasted, and its not going to change, so I might as well move on.  Letting go is always so hard though, because although I try to convince myself that this is necessary, there is that lingering thought that maybe things could have been different.  I guess I'll never know.

so, i got some piercings last night and it was good.  I got a horizontal surface piercing below my belly button (which was already pierced) and i got my septum done!  yaay!!!  next thing on the list is my tattoo.

ALSO, I redid my livejournal layout.  I think it looks pretty neat.  I've been in a buddhist appreciation sort of mood lately (like for the past few months).  And plus, I've always enjoyed this color scheme.

I'm taking a "learn at lunch" class here at good 'ol Raytheon.  It is called "Missile Interceptor Hardware in the Loop Simulation."  The first paper I had to read was called "Basic Missile Simulation Elements."  There is just something really cool about getting to learn about missile simulations as a job. Set aside my feelings about war and such.  This is just plain cool.

In the first 1-hour class we went over first-order differential equations, spring models, second-order and non-linear models, and our homework was to write some matlab code to model a spring.  w00t.  

KaBoom!

So, I'm moving back home to Gardner!!  I'm really excited.  I really liked living in Somerville, and I may move back there someday, but for right now, I miss hometown friends and quiet life, and things being cheap.  So, I'm moving in with an old friend, someone I worked with for a number of years in high school and who I have recently reconnected with, Kristal.  We are renting a really cheap place on Sherman St., literally a block from the house I lived in all my life!!!  Moving in on Oct 15, but the landlord is going to let me have keys this week so I can fix some stuff up and paint.  I'm hoping I can convince my dad to help me out with this endeavor since Kristal is off on a business trip for a few weeks.  In general though, I am really really excited to have my own place again and to get all my stuff out of storage!!!  Esp the cooking stuff.  YUM

I feel like I need to be appreciative of some really good friends in my life.  So, if you want to learn about my friends, or see what I have to say about you, this is the blog for you!!  This will probably take many entries to complete.  These are in no particular order :) 

<lj-cut text="Runcie">Jason Runcie.  I met him freshman year at WPI.  We were on the same floor and if I remember correctly, we didn't know each other for many weeks, if not months.  When we finally started hanging out, we became fast friends.  I honestly don't remember everything from the early days because it seems like ages ago now.  He's one of those people I get the feeling that I've known forever.  He's always been the type of person that I could just hang out with and not have to feel like I was entertaining.  We would just listen to music, surf the web, watch movies, talk about life.  We basically spent a ton of time together.  He taught me tons about computers.  He puts up with my crap.  He is one of the only people in the world that I truly trust with my life.  He's one of the only people in the world that I feel like I don't have to hide anything from.  He and I call each other on our bullshit.  There is nothing I don't think I could say to him.  He has always been there for me when I needed it, and I'll always be there for him.  There have been times when we've lost touch, but never really for long, a few months, but it always feel just the same when we get back in touch.  The best thing is, I can always count on him when I need him, and I can always count on him to be honest with me.  If he doesn't want to do something, he'll just say he doesn't feel like it.  No bullshit lies about having other plans or being sick, or whatever.  Also, I can always count on him to tell me when I'm being a complete idiot.  Everyone needs that, but some people are just shy or whatever.  </lj-cut>

We went to Thailand (not so much a road trip), he came with me to help move my parents from Florida back up here, he drove with me to Tennessee to see Bonnaroo 2005, he's been snowboarding in Maine with me, he has helped me move (just a sucker for punishment) and the last move was a real doozie (I can't thank you enough Mark!!!) We've both had our mountains to climb and I think a lot of heartache to get over after Hollie's death, but we recently got in touch again and I'm so glad!! So, I've been thinking a lot about honesty lately.  Its so easy to want to beleive that things are black and white, but that is def not how this world turns.  Honesty is a concept squarely residing in the fuzziest of gray areas, at least in my opinion.  The thing is, raw emotion is completely irrational and uncontrollable.  I like to think that any lies I tell are in the direct interest of keeping someone from some sort of heartache, or (more selfishly) in pursuit of my own best interests (look, sometimes you have to be in it for your own sake).

Many people lie because it makes them feel better about themselves at the moment.  Like lying to people about why you don't want to date them.  Most of the time, I think people just feel like jerks if they give the real (probably "shallow") reason why they aren't into it.  Or, people lie to make themselves look better.  I am not a fan of this type of lying.  Its super selfish, and only usually causes more heartache and confusion and with only minimal gains.  Also, I think if you do it long enough, you end up convincing yourself you are someone that you are not.  If you convince yourself that you are better than you are ('better' being a very subjective term) you will never try to better yourself.  

I watched an episode of House the other day with friend.  I've seen the episode before and had many conversations about it.  Basically, its about a lesbian couple.  One is in liver failure (we'll call her amy) and needs an immediate transplant and the other (we'll call her sara) offers to give half of her liver.  The twist is that amy was planning on breaking up with sara before she got sick.  There is an ethical dillema because the doctors are aware of this fact and they don't think that Sara is.  One doctor thinks that amy should tell sara before she goes through with the transplant.  House doesn't think she needs to.  The question is, what would you do?  could you live with yourself if you didn't tell your partner you wanted to break up before they donated an organ to you????  My answer is yes, I could live with myself.  I wouldn't say a word.  Really, you save the other person some heartache.  

<lj-cut text="Here are the reasons.">A) they must really love you to donate an organ, and very well might still donate it even if they knew you were breaking up.  
B) survival of the fittest, the fact is, your gonna die if you don't get the liver.  why take chances telling them in the off chance that they change their mind?  
C) if you get the transplant and then tell them afterward, they get the good shivalrous feeling that they donate an organ to someone who really needed it.</lj-cut>

Now this is obviously very selfish, but for good reason.  I think the mortality issue really makes the difference when it comes to honesty.  If you or someone else could die as a result of you telling the truth, fuck it, you need to lie.  If its a matter of your own pride, or minimizing your own heartache or discomfort, I think you need to suck it up and tell the truth.  There is nothing like the sting of reality to wake you up from a haze.  Besides, I would rather brutal, bold truth, which usually hurts like hell or churns your stomach to numbing ignorance.  I am one of those who thinks that feeling something, anything, whether it be good feelings or bad feelings, pain, joy, sickening dissapointment or intense euphoria is much better than nothing at all.  

So, those are just a few thoughts.  In general I think my issue with lying to save face, or to ease pain (granted, this seems like a noble pursuit) is that it is so hard to keep a lie enclosed in a nice little bubble, preserved, so that it is untouchable.  Normal course of events involves the person eventually finding out about the lie.  Then there is more heartache than before, usually fighting, feelings of betrayal, etc.  I just think that lying is a lot more work than its worth.  I wish more people realized that.  I also wish a lot more people were well-equiped to handle the truths of life.  Maybe that is the real underlying problem.  Everyones inability to cope.  

Dear everyone, get some fucking balls.

Lately I feel like nobody living nowhere with noone.  I think it mostly comes down to me not having a real home, where my stuff is.  Right now I'm living out of a few boxes at my friend Pete's place in Nashua.  Pete is a sweetheart for letting me crash there, and really easy to live with, and very understanding of the dog situation, etc.  The city of Nashua isn't bad at all, the commute isn't bad, the condo is actually really really nice, but somehow, I hate it.  So weird.  I don't use hate often, but I can really say with all honesty that I hate living there.  I think its because  my friends don't live there.  I have seriously been considering moving back to Gardner, just to regain some normalcy, sort of.  I had wanted to move back to Somerville, but I dont want to drag this out, and it might take longer to find a good reasonably priced place in Somerville.  In gardner, I can find a 2-bedroom for like $700!!!  And, it would be much easier to find a second job in or around gardner if I wanted to take a few nights a week waitressing or something for extra cash.  

I keep going back and forth between wanting to move away and start fresh and wanting desperately to stick around.  There are always opportunities to take assignments abroad, or temporary duty things in the US.  Recently I heard about the Japan one again, and one in Sunnydale, CA.  Both sound like great jobs.  There is always a part of me that just never wants anything to change, I think everyone wants that to some extent.  There are moments in your life you remember as being monumentally fun and you can't help but want that moment forever and people think that if they stay in the same city, or in the same job, that things will just stay that way.  Of course, it never does.  But no mattter where friends move to, etc, the fact remains that home is home, and the only place I truly feel home is in Gardner.

Also, I must post later about lots of other topics.  like honesty, poverty, war, House, friends, lust/emotion/deception, rugby, self esteem, music, and needing help.

...and mark was there for it all.  Although he may have been confused.  Luckily, I think he and Jay are the only people who know this exists.  So I think I'm free to tell the story here.

Last night I was supposed to have rugby, then go to the Burren to see Nate play.  I had been thinking of skipping rugby due to a hand injury anyway.  So I talked to a longtime "buddy" (don't pretend you don't know what I mean) of mine and invited him to the burren as well for some live music.  We decided to do dinner as well.  

Went to a really nice italian place for dinner.  Marino's I think.  Ordered a bottle of wine.  started drinking.  My buddy, we'll call him John, seemed distracted, not his usual talkative self.  I find out that the real reason he has had a bad day is that he talked to his ex earlier in the night whom he hadn't talked to in a long time.  long conversation about them, relationships in general, and then about my previuos relationships...and we are still downing this bottle of wine at a decent pace.  topic of getting back together with ex's emerges and I say I never would.  I say I don't think love is enough in some cases.  John tells me I'm cold.  COLD  this bothers me.  after dinner order irish coffees.  yum.  then realize what time it is and head to the burren.  beer.  hung out with caroline and nate, watched nate play, all is good...getting ready to call it a night, when who enters the bar but my ex and his good friend (with whom i've had relations).  So here I am sitting at a table with literally half of the men I have ever slept with in my life.  WORLDS COLLIDE!!!!!  that would have been fine, but my ex sees my friend john and after being introduced says, "ah, the infamous john."  nice job being discrete!  then they start talking and john says he thinks my ex is cool.  GREAT  then in my drunkeness i start having a deep convo with my ex.  this is all crazy and bad.  i'm still annoyed that john called me cold.  i'm not cold.  i'm protected.  is it cold to think that love is not enough?  

anyway, we eventually leave because john needs to get home.  stuff happens at my place, john ends up staying.  i set my alarm for 4:30 so he will have time to drive home etc in the morning.  4:30 is so early.  i couldn't sleep because i'm thinking about what "cold" means, the dog won't sit still and john is snoring.  suck  WTF mate  and the day ends in a death spiral (and i do mean death spiral) of passion, emotion, confusion and sadness.  I need to learn to play the guitar.  that's all

and to my friend mark, I apologize for involving you in the death spiral.  somehow I didn't see it coming.  I hope you still had a good time.  I owe you a trip out to your neck of the woods.  we should play some instruments and sing.  and get tattoos.  YES

can i just say that if today doesn't end soon, i'm going to go nuts.  i'm just not into it...still overanalyzing some weekend drama which has me in a tizzy (that's right, tizzy).  haven't updated this in a while, but figured due to lack of actual humans to complain to, i'll jot a few incoherent ramblings here and feel better.  my real problem will never be solved until i make a decision i don't want to make.  so that sucks, i'm damned if i do, damned if i don't.  of course, its my fault, this whole thing has been lingering for months now, but I just keep putting it off.  I either go crazy in this weird sort of limbo, but continue on the path of physical gratification, or chose to turn that down and begin the ending of an era...  sad day.  is there a breaking point?  maybe...am i there yet?  i'm not so sure.  either way though, i suppose i've had my fun, and its got to end sometime.  maybe i'll just make this into a test of mental strength.  yeah, that'll be fun.  I don't understand how other people can drive us crazy like this and I wonder have I ever done this to anyone else before?  I feel sort of bad now, I hope I haven't.  heart breaker, dream maker, love taker....

its amazing how incredible great literature makes you feel.  something about connecting with humanity, or language, communication, i don't know.  I'm reading a book i picked up the other day, Borrowed Time: An AIDS Memoir by Paul Monette.  This guy can really write.  I'm not talking just evoking emotion, etc...he is also just very eloquent.  Read it.

"'What if we got it?'  I said, staring out at the otters belly up in the kelp beds, taking the sun.
I don't remember how we answered that, because of course there wasn't any answer.  Merely to pose the question was by way of another shot at magic.  Mention the unmentionable and it will go away, like shining a light around a child's bedroom to shoo the monster.  The great ache we were feeling at that moment was for our stricken friend and we were too ignorant still to evision the medieval tortures that might await him."
